Angelina Jolie Tunda Pindah ke Luar Negeri karena Brad Pitt
07 Nov 2019, 08:22 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Angelina Jolie mengungkapkan karena perjanjian perceraian dirinya dengan Brad Pitt, ia tak bisa menetap di luar negeri dengan anak-anaknya. (Frederick M. Brown/Getty Images/AFP)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Angelina Jolie menyinggung sang mantan suami Brad Pitt dalam sebuah wawancara terbaru. Aktris berusia 44 tahun itu mengungkapkan bahwa Pitt jadi salah satu penghalang dirinya memenuhi keinginan untuk anak-anak mereka.Jolie berbicara bahwa ia ingin putra-putri mereka bisa menjelajahi dunia, serta membawa enam orang anaknya pindah dan tinggal di luar negeri. Hanya saja, keinginan itu tak bisa diwujudkan karena terhalang kesepakatan perceraian dia dengan Pitt."Saya ingin tinggal di luar negeri dan akan melakukannya segera setelah anak-anak saya berusia 18 tahun," katanya kepada Harper's Bazaar edisi Desember-Januari 2019-2020."Saat ini saya harus berada di tempat ayah mereka memilih untuk tinggal," lanjut Jolie.Sementara tak bisa pindah secara permanen ke negara lain, Jolie dan anak-anak menggantinya dengan bepergian ke luar negeri. Hal itu dilakukan juga sebagai bagian dari pekerjaan Jolie sebagai aktor dan utusan khusus PBB."Tempat favorit saya adalah tempat saya belum pernah singgahi. Saya suka berada di tengah-tengah sesuatu yang baru. Saya menikmati berada di sesuatu yang berbeda dari biasanya," kata Jolie."Saya ingin anak-anak tumbuh di dunia - tidak hanya belajar tentang itu tetapi menjalaninya dan memiliki teman di seluruh dunia. Tahun depan kami akan membangun rumah di Afrika," papar bintang film Maleficent tersebut.Dalam wawancara yang sama, Jolie juga mengatakan bahwa dia dan anak-anaknya telah mengalami beberapa pengalaman sulit dalam beberapa tahun terakhir, termasuk perceraiannya yang sengit dengan Pitt."Mereka telah melalui banyak hal," ia mengakui kesulitan mereka, dikutip dari Aceshowbiz.Meski demikian, bintang "The Eternals" itu menyatakan bahwa masa-masa sulit tersebut tidak berdampak buruk pada keenam anaknya."Saya belajar dari kekuatan mereka. Sebagai orang tua, (kami) mendorong anak-anak kami untuk merangkul semua diri mereka, dan semua yang mereka tahu dalam hati mereka benar, dan mereka juga melakukan itu kepada kami serta menginginkan hal yang sama untuk kami," katanya. (agn/end)

Angelina Jolie Delays Moving Abroad because of Brad Pitt
Nov 7 2019, 08:22 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Angelina Jolie revealed that due to her divorce agreement with Brad Pitt, she could not stay abroad with her children. (Frederick M. Brown / Getty Images / AFP)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Angelina Jolie alluded to her ex-husband Brad Pitt in a recent interview. The 44-year-old actress revealed that Pitt became one of the barriers to fulfilling the wishes of their children. Jolie spoke that she wanted their sons and daughters to be able to explore the world, and bring their six children to move and live abroad. However, that wish could not be realized because it was hampered by his divorce agreement with Pitt. "I want to live abroad and will do so as soon as my children are 18 years old," he told Harper's Bazaar December-January 2019-2020 edition. At the moment I have to be where their father chose to live, "continued Jolie. While unable to move permanently to another country, Jolie and the children replaced her by traveling abroad. It was also done as part of Jolie's work as an actor and UN special envoy. "My favorite place is a place I have never visited. I like being in the middle of something new. I enjoy being in something different than usual," said "I want children to grow up in the world - not only learn about it but live it and have friends all over the world. Next year we will build a house in Africa," said the film star Maleficent. In the same interview, Jolie also said that he and his children have had some difficult experiences in recent years, including his fierce divorce with Pitt. "They have been through a lot," he acknowledged their difficulties, quoted from Aceshowbiz. Even so, the star of "The Eternals" stated that these difficult times did not have a bad impact on their six children. "I learn from their strengths. As parents, (we) encourage our children "to embrace all of themselves, and everything they know in their hearts is true, and they also do that to us and want the same for us," he said. (agn / end)
